intro: Nothoscordum euosmum, commonly known as the broadleaf garlic. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild garlic scent. Nothoscordum euosmum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and prefers full sun.
